user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_SymbolLookup_Static:
```c
int32 OS_SymbolLookup_Static(cpuaddr *SymbolAddress, const char *SymbolName, const char *ModuleName)
{
    int32                      return_code = OS_ERR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED;
    OS_static_symbol_record_t *StaticSym   = OS_STATIC_SYMTABLE_SOURCE;

    while (StaticSym != NULL)
    {
        if (StaticSym->Name == NULL)
        {
            /* end of list --
             * Return "OS_ERROR" to indicate that an actual search was done
             * with a not-found result, vs. not searching at all. */
            return_code = OS_ERROR;
            break;
        }
        if (strcmp(StaticSym->Name, SymbolName) == 0 &&
            (ModuleName == NULL || strcmp(StaticSym->Module, ModuleName) == 0))
        {
            /* found matching symbol */
            *SymbolAddress = (cpuaddr)StaticSym->Address;
            return_code    = OS_SUCCESS;
            break;
        }

        ++StaticSym;
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: The function parameters SymbolName and ModuleName are already const-qualified, so they do not require further investigation. The output parameter SymbolAddress is intentionally non-const because it is written to (assigned a symbol address) and therefore should not be const. No other pointer objects appear in the function. The listed fragments all involve the StaticSym pointer or accesses through it; StaticSym (and/or the pointee type and its character-data members) should be reviewed to determine whether the pointer should point to a const-qualified OS_static_symbol_record_t (and whether its Name/Module members should be const char*) in order to comply with MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13.
